name: Ronald Redd
text: Great Dive Experience with a great crew. Can't wait to go again.

name: Lynda Tiefel
text: Great crew, plenty of room on the boat, very organized.

name: Tony Day
text: Took my Open Water and Advance Open Water here. Great dive shop and great instructors. My experience has been excellent!

name: Wes Christie
text: I had a great experience getting my open water certification and would highly recommend ScubaVentures.  Mark and other instructors are very hands on and make you comfortable.  Looking forward to some trips with this group in the future.

name: Dylan Jardine
text: Great instructor and staff, perfect for people that are just getting into scuba diving. The equipment there is top of the line. If you live in the Birmingham area buy your equipment there, and if something does not work take it back and they will sort it out. No fuss no muss and your out.

name: Cindy Pierce
text: Great people. Good selection of products.

name: Dee DaSilva
text: Loved it and I am going back

name: Hank Hankerson
text: I walked in looking to purchase some gear and 3 associates/owners/customers were standing around with a dog. I said I was interested in purchasing some gear for an upcoming trip and none of them looked up and continued with their conversation. The dog came over a few times for pets and was clearly the only one interested in earning any business. After staring at the display items for 10 minutes with no assistance I left the store.

name: eric brosch
text: Excellent experience. The staff is well trained and highly skilled in both the diving and retail aspects of the business. Friendly, helpful and knowledgeable, Mark, Traci and Mackenzie ensure a quality experience whether you are a novice or seasoned diver.

name: Sara Harper
text: Excellent service and staff. Every time we've been to ScubaVentures, we've been impressed with the friendliness and  professionalism of Mark, Makenzie and Traci. They go the extra mile to make sure you are equipped with all you need, ensuring your scuba adventure is the best. Thank you to these three that helped us immensely last week!

name: Charlie
text: Great dive shop!  The staff is all friendly and knowledgeable.  They have everything you need to dive.  My daughter and I started diving a couple of months ago and they have taken care of everything including trips, certification classes, gear, and have spent lots of time answering all my questions.  :)

name: Candace Padgett
text:
Review for Open Water course - I highly recommend  ScubaVentures and Blue Water Park. Tip: They have more classes available than what is shown online so stop by the shop or give them a call.
I was able to get my Padi Open Water Certification over the course of two weekends, excluding the e-learning that I did on my own time. Clint was our instructor and was amazing. Very patient with everyone's skill/comfort level, thorough with the material, and flexible with everyone's schedule (ours in particular since we had a commute). Will definitely return when we go for our Advanced Open Water.

name: Dixie Lauderdale
text: This is the best dive shop in Birmingham! They are very helpful and knowledgeable about everything to do the SCUBA. If you are looking to get certified, need a refresher course, need gear, etc. they will have all you need to do so!

name: Brooke Brasher
text: I completed my open water PADI certification with Scuba Ventures in Vestavia. Great team of people, very knowledgeable and friendly! They were able to answer all of my questions on diving and gear. I would absolutely recommend these guys for certifications, gear, trips, etc. Their love of diving is definatly contagious!

name: Mike Reynolds
text: Very professional and fun group of divers. Mark and the gang will set you up good!

name: Rolanda Horton
text: Great instructors - VERY patient and knowledgeable. They love what they do and it’s infectious.

name: Greg Ottwell
text: I was in the shop on 7/21/18 and went in with the intent to purchase two complete sets of gear for me and my wife, it was the Absolute worst service I have ever received! The dog the old lady had in the store was barking, it was obnoxious!! The old lady working there clearly didn't have a clue about anything (air headed doesn't begin to describe her) especially diving related! The young girl working there ignored me,she seemed spaced out, the owner was there and wouldn't help me he stayed in his office, and to top it off the only thing anyone asked me asked me was if I wanted to give her mutt a dog treat?!?!?  What type of customer service is this??? what type of unorganized dive shop is this?? will be going elsewhere from now on!

name: Mont Jaymz
text: Horrible Service. Horrible owner .. Gear stays for weeks that turn to months with no call... Has happened to 4 of my dive buddies, myself and my father .. Each who swear they'll never go there again. Save ur money go to Panama City Divers Den or Dive Locker ... Ull get ur gear done right and shipped back to you or given back that day .. Oh n air fills 5 bucks.

name: Chad Hill
text: Incredible prices, too notch salespeople and teachers who really care about their craft.  I've been diving for years and this is were I choose to take my children to learn!!!

name: Lee Winnige
text: Great service and knowledgeable staff. Whether for purchasing equipment, training or booking a trip.

name: Chris Stantis
text: The owner is helpful and friendly. Take one of their PADI classes and get certified!

name: Robert Evans
text: Staff knows their stuff.

name: Scott Sutton
text: The staff is very friendly, extremely helpful without being pushy.  Great place for professional dive advice and gear.

resp.text: Thank you Scott. We appreciate your business.

name: Heath Skelton
text: The Open Water Certification class was great, and the staff is friendly and helpful in my experience.

resp.text: Thanks for the feedback Heath. We enjoyed having you in our class and look forward to more diving adventures with us!

name: dennis robertson
text: Been doing business with them for years.  They have what I want and need to go diving safely and efficiently.

name: Jason Trodglen
text: I couldn't ask for more from a local business. The staff are always very helpful and knowledgeable about their products. Their prices are very reasonable and I enjoy doing business with this dive shop.

name: Shaun Starnes
text: Excellent dive shop, the staff is knowledgeable and they offer a lot of courses to advance your diving skills. The staff gives great advice in regards to purchasing new equipment. All around great dive shop.

name: gus buffler
text:
Equipment way too expensive, buy that somewhere else.
But Shawn and the rest are great instructors.I enjoyed the lessons.

name: Todd Knight
text: Staff is friendly and helpful, but they DO NOT service scubapro, spare air, etc ...... The website doesn't list any specific brands, which leads one to believe that any gear can be serviced...nope.

resp.text: Hi Todd, we are sorry we are not able to service your equipment. We formerly had an outside service we could send these brands to but they have recently closed their business. We have searched for a replacement but have been unable to find one that would be financially feasible. We will add the brands we can service to our website. Thanks for pointing out that.

name: john england
text: Great dive shop. Always friendly and top notch service!

name: Corey Spurgeon (Sideswipe)
text: Love the place the people working there is always willing to help

name: Hugh “Chappy” Chapman
text: Top notch service and equipment available.  Classes are not only professional but a joy to take.  Great dive shop deserving of 5 Star PADI rating.

name: Chris White
text: My family and I have taken several classes with SDI and have enjoyed every aspect of the training!  Everyone I’ve had the opportunity to meet and learn from has been very knowledgeable and enthusiastic in sharing the sport of scuba diving with me!  I’m looking forward to blowing more bubbles!  Thanks Sean, Max, Mox and Greg!

name: Glen Strobach
text: Took our equipment to SDI for a rebuild last year and put everything away.  Fast forward to 11 months later, took the equipment out and went diving.  The secondary octo's leaked air straight off the bat.  I took them back in to the store and explained that they must have adjusted something wrong and to please look at them.  The agreed to re-adjust for no fee since they did the work.  The "couple" days turned into a week and I heard nothing.  After stopping to check on them I was told they were next in line to be worked on "he thinks" but he will have the guy call me.  I requested a phone cal either way so I could arrange picking them up.  1 week later (today) I stopped in to check on them and they were still not completed and yes, NO phone calls or communication either way.   I took my faulty equipment back and will look to mail them or just buy new ones (not from SDI).  Worst customer service afetr the sale I have ever seen PERIOD!  The only way they stay open is being the only game in town.....  Run Away!

name: Scott Tennant
text: A dive shop in Dothan!!! It has been open for a year now at time of this post with very professional, experienced and fun dive instruction from from Chris Ball owner. My wife and I are working on additional certificates. Two of our kiddos have received their open water dive certificates with Performance Scuba as well. Lots of family fun and memories have started here. Thank you Chris, Megan and Tyler!

name: Timothy Gilley
text: Had to get my air gun tank filled and set up, cost me 10.00 definitely will be back, very nice people there

name: Patrick Thomas
text: Chris and his family are amazing. The best diver I've ever dove with without a doubt. The classes are fantastic, the service is fast and a fair price!

name: Sky Morris
text: I got my open water with these guys and the whole experience was awesome! Indescribably fun. They know their stuff and take time to make sure you know it too. Very helpful with all the equipment and gear you need, plus the ice-cream is pretty good

name: Matt L
text: Nice shop extremely friendly staff. Got 3 tanks filled and a valve fixed fast and professional service. They do dive trips too!

name: brobi086
text: I am so excited to have found this dive shop. Very professional and they offer a lot. Definitely would recommend them to anyone. My children loved getting their Open Water training from here. If you are considering getting a SCUBA certification, I would encourage you to get your training here.

name: Tony Kizziah
text: Awesome shop and great customer service.

name: John Keys
text: This is a top of the Line shop! I'm so glad to have somewhere close to home that has everything you need!

name: Steve Devine
text: Nice, knowledgeable people.  Will be doing my SCUBA business here!

name: Tyler
text: This place had everything from Open Water to Rebreather!  Cant wait to take my next SDI/TDI class!

name: Jeremy M.
text: Owners are very friendly and go out of their way to help answer questions or get what you are looking for

name: Treva Sexton
text: I had an amazing time! John was great and very friendly.  I would definitely recommend this spot for your next dive trip.  We will be back.

name: Jon S
text: Great place to dive!  Awesome instructor!!

name: Michael Frye
text: The quarry is beautiful, facilities are clean and the water is clear! John, the owner, is extremely friendly and helpful and takes great pride in this treasure of a place he runs. I highly recommend stopping by.

resp.text: Thank you Michael, that means a lot for a family operated facility. We look forward to your next visit.

name: PSN Homicide58x
text: It’s nice

name: Corey Spurgeon (Sideswipe)
text: It's a great place to dive and meet new people and John's a great guy and fun to talk too.

name: Richie Woodall
text: Very cool experience. We were pleasantly surprised.

name: M S
text:
Disappointing by far. Visited with a small group earlier this month and was frustrated from the moment we parked. The man running the shop is clearly up charging for anything he can - $5 for a by standee to sit and “bubble watch”.

The rental shop itsself was a disaster from an organization, cleanliness and customer service standpoint. Thousands of dollars of expensive equipment thrown into the floor and in poor condition. I had the wonderful experience of using the restroom which clearly has never been cleaned. I knocked ants off of the toilet paper to use it. When I made a passing comment about the conditions of the shop and equipment, the man at the front desk stated “you don’t dive in the shop”.... doesn’t matter. This is still a representation of you and how you run your business!

When turning the overpriced and outdated equipment back in, the owner had the audacity to ask if we called the regs and if we didn’t, that they would have been damaged in the rinse process. I assume the only way his equipment stays somewhat in tact is if his customers provide care for it rather than himself. Pictures have been added to google for support. Needless to say, we won’t be back!

name: Tina Spoon-Mobley
text: Not what I expected. The only bathroom was a porta potty. There was a dead animal in the water in which we were diving, it seemed to be about the size of a medium dog, when I informed the owner it was as if he didn’t believe me and then there was no further action.

resp.text: It was a small dear that had fallen off the side of the mountain. It was spotted and moved to a different location in the quarry. Not all dive destinations even have a portapotty.

name: Dawn Trainer
text: Very responsive to inquiries. Can't wait for their season to open!

name: Nancy Burton
text: Great place easy access,good people ,can make several different type  dives in one place  . Time to get back in the water

name: Brian Shackelford
text: Really Nice Place To Dive.  Everyone Was Very Friendly.  I Love The Convenient Covered Areas To Unload and Stage Your Gear, and a place Clean to Rest, Get Dressed, and to Cool Off.  Would Highly Recommend This Park.  Water Can Get Really Cold, but you can stay at Thermocline and stay comfortable.  I will be back soon.

name: Sam Ogilvie
text: I took my initial training at dive land park great people with a passion for scuba diving. I did all of my certification dives there. Rental gear is available and is in good working order. The entry point is great, very easy access, you can drop off your equipment out of your car to the prep area about 20 feet and then it’s about 6 stairs down to the water. There are several platforms and a lot to see. There are concrete statues, beautiful large koi fish, massive boulders, aircraft all well within open water certification limits.  Water clarity is pretty good. It does get cold at 30 plus feet so bring a wetsuit and a hood. They have classes and trips for all summer.  They accept cash and PayPal.

name: Darrell Downing
text: Great dive location.  Excellent location for training from the beginner to the tech guys.  He has lines underwater running to the training platforms.  He stayed open late for us to complete our dives.  No questions, complaints, or extra charges.  It's still a work in progress.  He is working on showers and bathrooms.  He has porta Johns and changing rooms.  Cant wait to go back

name: Wendy Uhlman
text: Great time.....

name: Meghan Davis
text: Definitely going to be returning
